text.content:
A skill can be rolled by clicking the skill name on the character sheet. You can also roll a characteristic by clicking on the characteristic name.

This will bring up a dialog that allows you to select which characteristic to use, set a difficulty and add a Dice Modifier. If the actor is not a token, then an Edit option will be shown in the top right corner which allows you to edit a skill.

By default a target difficulty of 8 is assumed. Each skill has a default characteristic, which can be changed when you make the roll.

If you select Remember characteristic then the default for this skill will be changed.

Quick Rolls

Holding shift when clicking a skill will perform a quick roll, which skips the dialog and assumes defaults on everything.

The configurable Default to Quick Rolls can be used to reverse this behaviour. If selected, clicking a skill with perform a roll with default settings, and holding shift will open the dialog.

If you Ctrl-click on a skill on a character sheet, then it will open the Experience dialog.

This allows you to add experience points to a skill when training it up. If this actor is not a token, then there will also be an Edit button on the top right of the dialog. This can be used to edit the skill.

When you submit the dialog, it will calculate whether you have enough experience to level up, and automatically level up that skill.

A skill with extra experience on it as a + symbol next to it on the character sheet.

The Study Notes field allows you to record time spent studying the skill.

Bonuses

It is also possible to add specific bonuses to a skill from this dialog. This is a simple way to add a species based or similar bonus.

You can also change the default type of roll for this skill to be a Boon or Bane.

The Skill notes will be displayed when the roll is made.

Effects

This displays current effect bonuses applied to the skill, and provides a button to set them back to zero. You can't otherwise modify these effects from this dialog.

You can edit a skill on an actor by clicking the Edit link on skill roll and skill experience dialogs. This allows you to edit or delete the skill in question.

This option is only available on character sheets opened directly from the Actor entry in the Actor sidebar, or from character sheets opened from a linked token.

A skill can be added from the Add skill option on the Settings tab of most character sheets.

Packages

The Package actor type behaves slightly different in a couple of respects. Firstly, the Add skill option is directly available on the skill sheet.

Secondly, when a skill is deleted, it isn't actually deleted but instead marked as deleted.

When the package is dragged onto another actor (an NPC or Traveller), it will remove that skill from the target actor.

This can be used to modify what skills are available for characters.

Any new skills will also be added to the target actor.
